Message.Title: Why shouldn't Google Acquire Nvidia?
Message.Msg: NVDA is another public company somewhat like Motorola Mobility, but it's in an even more valuable strategic position relative to Google in the Platform War, and being undervalued by the market to have even higher degree. GOOG would need to find a way around thet ROFR that MSFT likely still has in place... perhaps just making an offer that'd ensure Jensen's staying in charge and running things as a wholly owned subsidiary and a nice premium would be too much for MSFT to match?

Topic.Title: Why shouldn't Google Acquire Nvidia?

Message.Msg: *undervalued by the market to an even higher degree

Topic.Title: Weekly Call Option Strategy:

Message.Msg: I've had great luck in the past 2 weeks trading near and in the money 2/16 calls.I started watching the chart and saw that the stock swings nearly 1% each day.My strategy has been to buy the calls when the share price appears to be at the low for a one or two day period and then put in a GTC sell for 30% above purchase price no mater how strong or weak it's looking.It's worked like a charm but I know it's sophomoric. Does anyone hear have a strategy they'd care to share.TIA.

Topic.Title: Weekly Call Option Strategy:

Message.Msg: buy june 22 $700 puts for $1050 each. Countertrend especially with google hitting new high friday but look at daily and weekly charts. Top of bollinger bands and weekly especially getting significant RSI Divergence. Exact same setup that appl had when it hit $705. If you believe the hype that this trend is legite and seqestration be ignored then buy $900 calls for june. If you believe technical indicators more than just a trend line, buy deep OTM puts. Call it stupid but it defines your risk and if you'd done the same thing with appl and bought the $475 puts in sept at its peak you'd have paid $500 a contract and could have sold them in nov for 5 times your investment or jan for 9 times your investment. They call it a herd for a reason.

Message.Title: BBC - EU 'may take action' against Google over privacy policy
Message.Msg: 18 February 2013 Last updated at 12:19 ET EU watchdogs plan to take action against Google by this summer over the web giant's current privacy policy, French privacy regulator CNIL has said.
